definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom)/fig. etched in one's memory/unforgettable
Guo "Terry" Taiming (1950-), prominent Taiwanese businessman, founder of Foxconn
Luo Baoming (1952-), sixth governor of Hainan
Pei Ieoh Ming or I.M. Pei (1917-2019), Chinese-American architect
engraved in one's heart and carved in one's bones (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
Ku Hung-ming or Gu Hongming (1857-1928), Malaysian man of letters, highly regarded for his literary works written mostly in English, and known for his monarchist views
engraved in one's heart and carved in one's bones (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
MaxSun, PRC company specializing in video and computer display

sentences.english: Mr Obama and his mother first set up home in the Menteng Dalam area of Jakarta。
sentences.chinese: 刚到印尼时，奥巴马与母亲住在雅加达的铭登区。

sentences.english: At a depth of twenty or thirty feet there is but little variation from the mean temporature of the year.
sentences.chinese: 正是铁尺，我有一枝类似的铭雍正十年春月。

sentences.english: Memories of happier days were enshrined in the old man's heart.
sentences.chinese: 对与幸福时光的回忆铭窟麏窒人的心中。

sentences.english: RC flying is a good learning process for Bandon.
sentences.chinese: 遥控飞行对小童铭也是一个很好的学习过程。

sentences.english: It is iron ruler, I have one with date: Spring, 15th year, Yongzheng reign, Qing.
sentences.chinese: 正是铁尺，我有一枝类似的铭雍正十年春月。

definition: (of the day) long/old variant of 暢|畅[chang4]
to respect/to admire/to venerate/by the emperor himself
bright/luminous/white (esp. bright white teeth of youth or white hair of old age)
